org.siframework.abbi.servlet
Class SearchProcessor

java.lang.Object
  org.siframework.abbi.servlet.SearchProcessor

public class SearchProcessor
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements the basic framework of a search processor. It contains a number of utility methods to get and validate request parameters.

Author:
212042380

getRequestParameters

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRequestParameters(java.lang.String name)

getParameter

public java.lang.String getParameter(java.lang.String name)
Gets a parameter that should appear only once by name. Sends an SC_BAD_REQUEST error when running in STRICT mode if the parameter appears more than once.

Parameters:
name - The name of the parameter to retrieve.
Returns:
The parameter, or null if the parameter is not present.

getISODateParameter

public java.util.Date getISODateParameter(java.lang.String name)
Gets a date parameter. Uses getParameter() because date parameters can only be specified once. Converts it to a Date value. In STRICT mode, if the date value is not correctly formatted, will generate an SC_BAD_REQUEST error.

Parameters:
name - The name of the date parameter.
Returns:
The date parameter, or null if not present.

getDateRangeParameter

public java.util.Date[] getDateRangeParameter(java.lang.String name,
                                              boolean isISO)

getDateParameter

public java.util.Date getDateParameter(java.lang.String name)
Gets a date parameter. Uses getParameter() because date parameters can only be specified once. Converts it to a Date value by assuming it is an integer offset in seconds from January 1, 1970. In STRICT mode, if the date value is not correctly formatted, will generate an SC_BAD_REQUEST error.

Parameters:
name - The name of the date parameter.
Returns:
The date parameter, or null if not present.

getIntParameter

public long getIntParameter(java.lang.String name)
Get an integer parameter, using getParameter() because integer parameters can only be specified once. Converts to an integer value. In STRICT mode if this is not a valid integer, generates an SC_BAD_REQUEST error.

Parameters:
name - The name of the parameter
Returns:
The integer value of the parameter, or 0 if not present.

getArrayParameter

public java.lang.String[] getArrayParameter(java.lang.String name,
                                            java.util.Set<java.lang.String> values)
Get a set of parameters from a fixed list of values

Parameters:
name - The name of the parameter to retrieve
values - The set of legal values, or null if all values are OK.
Returns:
An array containing the values returned.

sendError

public void sendError(int sc,
                      java.lang.String message)
Send the specified error to the user agent in response to a request.

Parameters:
sc - The error code to return
message - A text message explaining the error.

getABBIAPIParameters

public SearchParameters getABBIAPIParameters()

getFHIRAPIParameters

public SearchParameters getFHIRAPIParameters()
Get the search parameters, per the FHIR xdsentry specification. Extracts the search parameters from the query string. n : integer Starting offset of the first record to return in the search set count : integer Number of return records requested. The server is not bound to conform id : token The id of the resource [NOT SUPPORTED] repositoryId : string repository - logical or literal url [NOT SUPPORTED] mimeType : string mime type of document format : qtoken format (urn:.. Following rules) class : qtoken particular kind of document type : qtoken precise kind of document documentId : string document id - logical or literal url [NOT SUPPORTED] availability : string Approved | Deprecated [NOT SUPPORTED] confidentiality : qtoken as defined by Affinty Domain created : date date equal to time author created document created-before : date date before or equal to time author created document created-after : date date after or equal to time author created document event : qtoken main clinical act(s) language : string human language (RFC 3066) folderId : qtoken folders this document is in patientId : qtoken subject of care of the document patientInfo : qtoken demographic details author.name : string name of human/machine author.id : qtoken id of human/machine facilityType : qtoken type of organizational setting practiceSetting : qtoken clinical speciality of the act homeCommunity : string globally unique community id service.start : date date equal to Start time service.start-before : date date before or equal to Start time service.start-after : date date after or equal to Start time service.stop : date date equal to Stop time service.stop-before : date date before or equal to Stop time service.stop-after : date date after or equal to Stop time comments : string comments as specified by affinity domain

Returns:
The API Parameters filled in from the Query String

getMHDAPIParameters

public SearchParameters getMHDAPIParameters()
Get search parameters for MHD from the query and return them typeCode practiceSettingCode creationTimeFrom creationTimeTo serviceStartTimeFrom serviceStartTimeTo serviceStopTimeFrom serviceStopTimeTo formatCode mimeType (not an MHD parameter)

Returns:
the Search parameters found.

initializeFeed

public Feed initializeFeed(java.lang.String outputFormat)
Initialize a new Feed for return by a search request

Parameters:
outputFormat -
Returns:
A new feed, initialized from properties and business rules

processQuery

public Feed processQuery(API.Mode searchMode,
                         java.lang.String outputFormat)
Process a query 1. Get the Query Parameters 2. Send them to the back end to get results as Atom Entries 3. Filter the pertinent results 4. Attach the entries to an Atom Feed and return it to the caller

Parameters:
searchMode - The API mode to use when parsing query parameters
outputFormat - How the output will be generated
Returns:
An Atom Feed containing the search results.

getTargetMimeType

public static java.lang.String getTargetMimeType(java.lang.String sourceType,
                                                 java.lang.String[] targetList)
Given a source mime type, and a set of possible target mime types, returns the first target mimeType to which the source can be converted.

Parameters:
sourceType - The mime type of the found document
targetList - The requested set of target mime types
Returns:
One of the mimeType values in targetList, or null if none are applicable

transformableTo

public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> transformableTo(java.lang.String mimeType)
Return a set of strings indicating what outputs can be generated from content in the passed in mimeType

Parameters:
mimeType - The mimeType of the source document
Returns:
A set of mimeTypes that the source document can be transformed to.

filterResults

protected java.util.List<Entry> filterResults(java.util.List<Entry> results,
                                              java.lang.String[] mimeTypes)
Filter a list of entries by mimeType values. Removes any entries that are neither in the specified mimeType nor can be mapped to it.

Parameters:
results - The results to filter
mimeTypes - The set of mimeTypes to filter by
Returns:
A list of entries that are either in the specified format, or can be mapped to it.
